website_summaries.verdict: An officially-licensed remote that can support your PS4 and your entertainment system.
pros: With the ability to pair with 4 devices via Bluetooth, this capable remote can become your only remote if you have compatible devices
The Bluetooth connectivity works well, and the remote is compatible with most IR devices
This remote includes the standard PlayStation buttons and is designed to be used in conjunction with PlayStation 4 apps
cons: Bluetooth turns off after 30 minutes to conserve battery, and there's no way to turn your PS4 on with the remote

customer_reviews.title: This remote works great with our PS4
customer_reviews.text: This remote works great with our PS4. Much better to use for watching TV with Playstation Vue than the game controller. Pro: The volume punch through works with our Samsung TV, so don't have to fiddle with buttons for a simple volume change. Con: After a stretch of inactivity, getting used to having to wait a few seconds for the PS4/remote to wake up before using remote.
customer_reviews.author: K.R.Ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: The BEST remote for you PS4!
customer_reviews.text: I have NO complaints about this remote! This is the similar model I had for my PS3, and I LOVED it. When I first got my PS4, I ordered this, but it seemed to not work consistently. Frustrated, I bought a simpler, cheaper model, made by PlayStation. It didn't even last a year before it died. So, I repurchased this model, and either I had a lemon the first time around, or they've made improvements! So far, this one is working fantastically and is still my favorite model of remote to use with my PS4 when watching DVDs, Blu Rays, or Streaming!
customer_reviews.author: Todd A. Kramme

customer_reviews.title: Connected to TV and PS4 in under a min.
customer_reviews.text: Might be 3rd party but its officially lic by Sony Was able to program the TV options to my LG in about 10 seconds. Took longer to pair with ps4 (20 seconds) than it did to program to my tv Im using this with Playstation Vue and its great not having to keep up with my Dualshock and a tv remote. Now I can keep my Dualshock on the charging rack and my TV remote in the drawer
customer_reviews.author: Ashton Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Problems with streaming apps
customer_reviews.text: First of all, it doesn't work on all the streaming apps and I wish I'd known that.. It doesn't work at all for me with Hulu. It also shuts off all the time and I have to press the PS4 button to turn it on. It's incredibly annoying. If I want to use the volume control I have to press the TV button. It's more of a pain to use than the controller. I wish I hadn't purchased this item at all. It works when I watch Bluray but that's rare for me.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Like Hulu/Vevo/etc. the buttons you expect to work
customer_reviews.text: It's works alright, for certain application most of the button doesn't work. Like Hulu/Vevo/etc. the buttons you expect to work, like X, Circle, Triangle, and square. It just doesn't. Which is a huge bummer! Cause Hulu is the spot where I watch my anime, and I can't exactly control the video. But for other applications like Netflix/HBO/ and YouTube, it works as it says it should do. If somehow they figure out how to get it universal like the box says I'll change my rate to 5stars!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie N

customer_reviews.title: You need this, but you will also hate it
customer_reviews.text: I loved the old remote for the PS3. This remote misses the mark, they even made it worse. This remote makes an audible clicking noise when you push a button, it is starting to piss my wife off. Also, the remote times out, and you have to turn it back on to use it in the middle of a movie. You would also think that Sony could figure out how to back-light this thing. This is a needed tool if you have a PS4, however, it is like Sony let some interns develop this as part of a class project.
customer_reviews.author: matth3wdean

customer_reviews.title: A must for Vue users but it's forced.
customer_reviews.text: It gets one star because Sony forces you to use it or the game controller but not a universal remote like on the PS3. I'm a new cord cutter and Playstation Vue is what I went with but after a month of using the game controller I gave in and bought this so I could stop dropping the controller, dealing with its battery dying after a lot of use and the light shining from the controller after every use. The controller itself has tiny buttons and with no backlit or glow in the dark buttons using it in the dark is a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Roach

customer_reviews.title: I bought this remote since June 2015. I had ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this remote since June 2015. I had been following the pre-launch hype which gave no indication that Sony would include backlighting. Sure enough, both the launch edition and 2nd edition remote do not have backlighting. Price-wise and functionality-wise, it's reasonable, however, it's a dealbreaker for me since most of my usage is in a dark room. I don't know what restricted Sony from including this feature which is now mainstream on new laptops, remotes, keyboards, etc.. Instead I have to fiddle around in the dark to find it and then focus to make sure I've got my fingers on the right button.
customer_reviews.author: Terran A. Eligon

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. It did not work within a couple of days. It is obvious this is not a Sony manufactured product. But a licensed product from a third part manufacturer. The product quality is not there. How can it fail after a couple days? My Sony PS3 remote has been knocked about more then I care to admit and it has never failed. Sony should have never have authorized this product. Like quite a few others, I do not recommend this product. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey45acp

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people are complaining about this remote because the "punch through" feature doesn't work on devices other than TVs (such as sound systems). I use my TV's built-in speakers, so I never had a problem with that. Other than that, when you first use the remote to operate the PS4, you need to push the PS4 button first, and sometimes even hold down the PlayStation icon button, which is an annoyance that the PS3 media remote didn't have. All in all, it feels like a trade-off - a little added inconvenience in exchange for power and volume controls for the TV on the remote. All in all, not bad, although it definitely could be improved upon.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob M McNeill

customer_reviews.title: Breaks
customer_reviews.text: I am on my third one since it came out. The remote stop working for no apparent reason. So why did I keep buying it.....The remotes dies and then and I can't keep up the charging when I play. Lack of options, but when it does work, it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: J.J.

customer_reviews.title: Worst Remote Of All Time
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, especially considering how great the official PS3 remote was. Battery life is awful, the volume control punch-through (for sound systems) doesn't work, the control buttons don't work with all video apps, and worst of all: the remote shuts off after 30 minutes of inactivity. So great, when I need to pause or stop in the middle of something I have to wait 10 seconds for the remote to reconnect again? Pointless. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: SamuraiEditor

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted this product to be amazing, and in the end
customer_reviews.text: We use our PS4 as our Blu-Ray player, and to watch Netflix, Amazon, Twitch, Hulu, etc. After years of using only a controller, we decided we deserved an actual remote and bought this. However, the batteries die on it so quickly, and there is no way to charge them, that we end up just using the controller anyways. Additionally, it does not work with some Apps (cannot go back in Hulu for example). I really wanted this product to be amazing, and in the end, we are back to using our controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Ckels

customer_reviews.title: Severely Lacking
customer_reviews.text: The remote for the PS3 made by Sony worked great. This one for the PS4 is virtually useless. The play and pause buttons do not work as they should. To pause a movie, you have to press the OK button and then hit it again to resume play. To turn the volume up or down on the TV, you have to first hit the TV button. This was not the case with the PS3 model. Also, the remote does not stay "on." I have to repeatedly hit the PS4 button on the remote to activate it. Don't bother buying this. You're better off just using the PS4 controller.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth D. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Long time coming...
customer_reviews.text: This remote does everything you need, and for the most part eliminates the need to use a controller. I love that it's universal and includes IR so you can use it to control your TV and other components. The only thing preventing this from being 5 stars is the fact that support is incomplete when you're using non-Sony apps. For instance, it doesn't work with Vudu. I'm not sure what the issue is, since it seems like the PS4 should just recognize it as a controller (it has buttons for all the controller inputs). Hopefully that small issue is fixed in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Get a different remote
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be good, since I love the PlayStation 3 remote, but it kept turning itself off and after a few months my system would recognize that it was connected, but then when I pressed any buttons, they wouldn't work. When I opened a support ticket at the company that made it, they closed the ticket without explanation, a suggestion of ways to fix the remote or finding out from me what happened. I wouldn't buy another one, and I'll be looking for a different media remote for my PlayStation 4.
customer_reviews.author: R. Weidmann

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to finally get an official remote for the ps4. For the most part it works, and on Bluetooth witch is great. But, no YouTube support, and no play pause or ff rr. If it can use the arrows for the menu and netflix... Why can't it do the same on YouTube? It makes no sense! This is supposed to be an official product, it should be compatible with everything as far as button mapping goes.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: My husband likes this remote but I do not. ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes this remote but I do not. It doesn't work for hulu so we still have to use the controller to hit the buttons while trying to watch or go through shows. That was the whole purpose to get the remote so we didn't need the controller. I guess my husband has other stuff he does on the ps4 that it works for but its no use for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great for use with PlayStation Vue and other media on PS4
customer_reviews.text: After dealing with years of using the standard controller to handle playback for DVDs and other media on my old PS3, when I bought my PS4 and started using the PlayStation Vue service, the need for a true remote was a no-brainer. With the available "Guide" and navigation buttons, along with the standard play, stop, pause, etc buttons, this remote makes it very easy for everyone in our house to be able to intuitively watch media on the PS4. The only drawback is sometimes the remote seems to "fall asleep" after periods of non-use, so you need to "wake it up". Other than that, it's a great choice for controlling your media on the PS4.
customer_reviews.author: John D Ragsdale

customer_reviews.title: Poor product.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after only using it a few times, and all it did was set on my coffee table. No damage or anything was ever done to it. I take care of my things. Changed to new batteries and still wont work at all. Dead. You have to turn this controller on each time you used it as well, it wasn't always on like the PS3 remote. Plus, if you turn the PS4 on with the remote then your normal controller isn't turned on either. The PS3 didn't have that problem with the remote and controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Anchorite

customer_reviews.title: It actually does work with hulu... Use the red button.
customer_reviews.text: Not all of the apps work with this remote. I pretty much use the PS4 and PS3 exclusively for streaming. I love the PS3 remote. The PS4 remote doesn't support Hulu. It works with Netflix and Prime, but with Hulu it can't even go back (the O button function). We literally have to close the Hulu app and relaunch it if we need to go back. It also seems to be very sluggish when using it to power on the PS4. Sometimes it takes 10 seconds to power up and sometimes it doesn't seem to respond at all. *update* I just found that the red button will go "back" in hulu.
customer_reviews.author: C Bass

customer_reviews.title: So so remote...
customer_reviews.text: Not a great remote. Purchased this so I could stop using the ps4 controller as a remote. This thing took about ten tries to pair with my ps4. Very frustrating. This is probably a Hulu app issue but the circle button on the remote fails to work as a back button. There's no way to go back on Hulu using the remote. Which means you have to close the app, open another app, then open Hulu again to find a different show to watch after you finish a show on Hulu. Again very frustrating. Don't have the same issue with the netflix app.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this remote a month ago. It is terrible. It is constantly disconnecting from my PS4. We continually have to reconnect it. And today, it decided to quit working altogether. I changed the batteries and tried several things but it's still not working. It's now a paperweight and not a very heavy one. I will be looking into sending it back even though the one month return window has passed. Hopefully Sony will fix this junk and come out with a remote that will actually work like the PS3 remote does.
customer_reviews.author: Roxy

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly designed and low quality.
customer_reviews.text: The intern must have designed this one, because this thing smacks of a complete ignorance of UI design. Buttons are very poorly placed and sized. They require far too much force to actuate, and output power is anemic (fresh batteries). Horrible product, but until someone makes an alternative, I'm stuck with using it... or maybe not. I may not be able to tolerate this thing for any length of time and may go back to using the controller. This remote should be a model of how not to design and manufacture a product. Update 2016/04/04: Nope. It's going back. Good riddance.
customer_reviews.author: Stumpus

customer_reviews.title: PS/4 sucks as DVD and BLU-RAY Player
customer_reviews.text: PS/4 sucks as DVD and BLU-RAY Player. The remote times out after awhile so you have to say MAY I? by holding down start button just to pause a disk! How weird is that? Then my wife put in a cracked DVD and it broke the PS/4 unit ! ! ! Went back to much easier to use PS/3 Backup unit which is easier to use by far! Sorry we bought the Play Station 4!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Matherne

customer_reviews.title: perfect for netflix and playstation vue!
customer_reviews.text: we bought this remote for 1 purpose, playstation vue! it works perfectly, and it controls our tv as well. 1 remote to rule them all. our tv does not support hdmi control unfortunately but we know someone that does, and they are able to use the channel up and down buttons to change the channels on the ps vue without having to go to the guide or quick menu each time. build quality is great, and aesthetically it matches the design of the ps4. love this remote
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great for pausing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I wouldn't have to use the game controller for watching movies. It works great for pausing, rewinding and forwarding. Great, that is, unless you watch more than 30 minutes or so at a time without pausing. If you watch the movie for an hour or so and then try to pause, the remote doesn't do anything. It seems to be in sleep mode. I can press the Top Menu button, which takes me back to the PS4 start screen and then return to the movie, but that's obviously more trouble than it's worth. I'm glad I found this out soon enough to take advantage of Amazon's return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard F. Small

customer_reviews.title: nope.
customer_reviews.text: It's not what you think. Why couldn't Sony just sell their PS3 BR remote for the PS4? That would solve the problems. I can't believe how they can ruin a remote but they did. It's not a Playstation remote that controls your TV/Amp volume (like the PS3 version). It's basically a universal learning remote that also has BT that happens to work a little bit with a PS4. There are so many quirks that I just use the dual shock controller and my amp remote instead.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Rose

customer_reviews.title: useless IR integration
customer_reviews.text: Buttons are all in the wrong location, useless IR integration, it's like a non-gamer designed it. Keeps falling asleep and eating up the batteries, the PS3 version lasted for over a year on a battery load, this one is at half batteries after a month. Doesn't function 100% in all PS4 apps. Missing the actual controller buttons, this remote acts like a Bluetooth keyboard vice a dualshock. 17 times worse than the PS3 remote, just wrong, wrong, wrong. I wanted to return it but it's at least better than always hitting the triggers on the controller....
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with Onkyo receiver
customer_reviews.text: The documentation indicates that the remote should be compatible with Onkyo stereo receivers. Unfortunately, the HT-RC430 doesn't seem to be compatible with this remote. None of the programming codes are recognized by the receiver. I reached out to PDP customer service, who don't pick up the phone or answer emails. The point of a "universal" remote is that it's supposed to work with all devices. I don't expect it to do everything, but at the very least it should do the things that the manufacturer claims it does.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Callot

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE...nothing like the PS3 version.
customer_reviews.text: We utilize our PS4 for most of our entertainment. The reason I do not like this product is because it is a piece of junk compared to the universal media remote that they designed for the PS3. This one rarely connects to the ps4 without a long delay. It does not have a "select" button that the normal PS4 remotes have. I was just sadly disappointed but it is somewhat necessary to keep because our normal PS4 game controllers die so quickly. I would pass on this remote if I were you. Definitely not worth the money. It is as if this isn't a real PS4 but rather a generic knock off version!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't live up to its name.
customer_reviews.text: I know this remote is licensed by Sony but I am not happy with it. My biggest complaint is that it doesn't work with every application. I don't know if it's a software issue or what. I'm using a Panasonic LED tv that has Viera (which allows me to control the PS4 with my TV remote), and I've had better luck with my TV remote than this remote. The Dual shock 4's have no issue but if you try and press the same buttons (i.e., "x" "o", etc., that you would on the dual shock), nothing happens with the remote). I've tested it with Hulu, Vudu, Netflix, and HBO go.
customer_reviews.author: Luistito

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: It took a few minutes to program, but once I did, it was up and running. I'm not sure why people are having trouble turning the PS4 on - the blue button at the top labeled "PS4" does an excellent job of powering the Playstation up with no problems. It paired with my LG TV with no problems, too, and is easier to use than the "Magic wand" remote that LG provided. And it's also compatible with my Comcast-provided set-top box with - again - no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Gamethyme

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this remote for the first 2 months. It worked fine. Now it will not work with the PS4. Brand new batteries and it will only respond for about 20 seconds, then stop working. Take out the batteries, put them back in and it works for another 20 seconds. I've tried to disconnect and reconnect the remote, but nothing works.
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: A great product marred by limited support and poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: This is a great remote overall. For use with navigating the OS, Netflix, or streaming media over my network (DLNA), it works spectacularly. The volume punch-through and universal remote features resolve all of my issues with the PS3 media remote. Unfortunately, many other apps such as Hulu Plus are not fully supported (play/pause doesn't work, and there's no way that I've found to go back to the main menu from a video without restarting the app), and the battery life is incredibly poor. In the 3 months I've owned this, I've changed the batteries about 3 to 4 times. If more apps support the remote, I'd upgrade to a 4 star rating, but the battery life is a major issue.
customer_reviews.author: P. Akundi

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it.
customer_reviews.text: After 3 days of use I am disappointed. Unlike the Samsung remote there isn't a big button to "go back" and the vast majority of the commands are small to the point that the Playstation dualshock controller is better so why buy this one ? I am seriously considering shipping it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If there's another option, go with that.
customer_reviews.text: We hate this thing. After a certain amount of time, this remote shuts itself down, presumably to save battery(?), and you have to turn it back on in order for any of the buttons to work. When you need to quick pause something (phone rings, etc.) you shouldn't have to turn the remote back on to do it. When you want to go back because you didn't catch what a character said/did, again, turn the remote back on to use the function?(!) Never seen such a screwy thing. And the kicker? It still eats batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Scarlett 101

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Tried to ignore other people's reviews, assuming they were isolated incidents, but this is pretty bad. I owned the PS3 iteration of this device for years, with no problems. With this one, pairing was a bit of a pain, and it would eat my batteries completely within 24 hours even while the system and remote were off. After a few days of that, the battery connectors stopped working all together and couldn't get any power to the device without wedging one of the batteries inside the compartment. Just exchanged it to see if the next one isn't a lemon. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Chris Carsillo

customer_reviews.title: Creates more work than just using the original remotes
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't just suck in comparison to the PS3 remote, it sucks period. No R2/L2, doesn't connect to my Onkyo receiver (rendering this useless), only has 3-4 programmable keys (no limit on the PS3 remote from what I recall) so you have to choose your most important functions. You have to press AMP to be able to control the volume on your receiver. No backlight so it's pointless in the dark. Awkward and inconvenient button placement. I could go on.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: This version for the PS4 has a much better layout than the PS3--I'm no longer accidentally skipping chapters ...
customer_reviews.text: The year I had the PS4 without this remote was agony. Until I had this remote, I relied on our old PS3 to watch movies on disc, because of the remote. This version for the PS4 has a much better layout than the PS3--I'm no longer accidentally skipping chapters or stopping playback with this new version. I just wish it had illuminated keys. I would buy a newer version if one had keys I could see in in low lighting.
customer_reviews.author: buk_reader

customer_reviews.title: The PS3 remote was better
customer_reviews.text: Remote works as expected. The problem I have with it is the fact that the remote turns off after not being used for awhile. So if you change the channel, start watching a show, and then 20 minutes later you want to change the channel again, you can't until you power the remote back on. Takes about 5 seconds. The PS3 remote was better.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Miles

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, but doesn't work the way it should
customer_reviews.text: Good concept, but doesn't work the way it should. Buttons don't do what the same buttons on the original ps4 gaming remote does. For example; If I need to hit the O button to go back, it sometimes works and sometimes doesn't. When it doesn't work, I am able to use the original remote that came with the ps4 and the O button does work. A lot of buttons seem to have this issue. and a lot of buttons just don't work. Was excited for this, but it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Rose

customer_reviews.title: This product solved my problem. Battery Life! Battery Life!
customer_reviews.text: This product solved my problem. I hate having to keep charging the PS4 controller every 5 minutes. I want steam my shows and don't have to worry about the batteries so this thing is awesome! It work great for Amazon Prime and Netflix. Hulu is not supported sadly. Everything seems to work except the back button. It's not a big deal to me. If I want to watch Hulu, I can just use my phone. I hope they support Hulu soon. Overall very happy with the product
customer_reviews.author: Envision112

customer_reviews.title: The product has a major issue. Battery life. ...
customer_reviews.text: The product has a major issue. Battery life. I replaced the batteries 3 times since I got it the day it was released with minimal use. I tried Energizer, a set of Duracells and finally a set of eneloops(rechargable). All were completely drained within one or two days of installing. The unit also does not work on alot of the Apps on the PS4. Maybe once a newer firmware is available for them, I might try it again.
customer_reviews.author: G. McAdams

customer_reviews.title: Better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: This product will work with the PS4 but it is a pain. After the unit has been on a while and you are watching something, you can't just hit pause. You have to hit the PS button a couple of times and then it usually takes you all the way out of what you are doing. I guess it's better than using the controllers. It doesn't compare at all to the previous remote for PS3.
customer_reviews.author: wes923

customer_reviews.title: Inconvenient.
customer_reviews.text: You have to change the remote's target to use the volume for the tv by pushing a button up top. Terrible design as obviously the PS4 has no volume, so why wouldn't the volume buttons remain dedicated to the TV? Time consuming enough so as to still have the TV remote handy. First world problems, I know - but c'mon, product designers!
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: even playing a blue ray is not that great..
customer_reviews.text: Sony, WTF? Basic PS4 APPS DON'T Even work properly, I know it's new, but come one, even playing a blue ray is not that great... Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, Vudu, You tube, all of these apps not one fully integrates with the remotes button interface... The IR interface for other components lacks luster as well, the auto volume would link to my Vizio TV, but not my Sony ES receiver... And sometimes hitting a button while in amp mode, the TV functions are activated in stead, shame on you Sony, down hill on overall quality lately!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon fan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!  Awful!  Does not work for most functions and even loses some after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Awful! This remote took forever to get working and repeatedly needs to be reset. After a few months it can turn on the PS4. For some reason it cannot perform any other PS4 functions. It can turn on and off my TV, but can only turn off my amp and work the volume. We have to turn the amp on by hand. The PS3 Remote by Sony was not only fully functional, but they improved on it with a new version. I will hoping for the same with the PS4. This goes to the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only one issue...
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should with the PlayStation 4 just wish you didn't have to push the TV and PS4 buttons to switch between devices. Volume should just work on the TV since the PS4 doesn't have a volume setting. I shouldn't have to push TV to turn up the volume then hit PS4 to go back to being able to control the PS4. That's my only complaint other than that it works good.
customer_reviews.author: Brotha Dave

customer_reviews.title: When strictly controlling the playstation the remote is fantastic but in order to turn up the volume on ...
customer_reviews.text: I gave the universal media remote 4 stars. I would have given it 5 if i didn't have to hit a button every time i wanted to control the t.v. or playstation. When strictly controlling the playstation the remote is fantastic but in order to turn up the volume on the television I must hit the t.v. button first and then in order to change something on the playstation I have to then push the ps4 button again. It is not a major issue and the remote works seamlessly otherwise. I would recommend this product to anyone who uses their ps4 for media simply because when using the ps4 controller you have to cut it off or it dies quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jarin Spradley

customer_reviews.title: Great remote, batteries not included
customer_reviews.text: Suited all my needs and operates like a standard bluetooth device while operating the PS4. You can also program it for your TV and works like a normal TV remote. One thing I wish would have been included somewhere in the product description would have been "Takes 2 AAA batteries (not included)." Luckily, I just so happened to have two spares laying around and didn't have to make a last-minute run to the store when the package arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Cory H.

customer_reviews.title: This remote was not made well and is not user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: This remote is terrible. I was so excited that there was finally a PS4 remote. I have been waiting for so long for one of these so that we wouldn't have to use our game controller to watch movies. None of the buttons work on it. You literally have to push the PS4 button and then enter or PS4 and then play or PS4 and then stop. It does not function the way it should. I am very surprised because it was made by Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Epperson

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this remote. I will probably be sending ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this remote. I will probably be sending it back. The volume punch through feature does not work with the AMP! What were they thinking??? If you have an AMP thats probably the device you want it to work with! Also, my amp is a sony amp, and the green programmable button that by default changes the device INPUT doesn't work. The manual says it can be reprogrammed, so I tried to reprogram it using the original remote so that it would work, but it doesn't appear you actually can do what the manual says. You can't reprogram that button, so you actually only have three reprogrammable buttons for a device.
customer_reviews.author: James L Moser

customer_reviews.title: Back to dualshock and device remotes
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Connection to the PS4 was a breeze! Neutral: App support just isn't there yet. Does allow for slight IR programming, was able to link up IR fan controls & light. Cons: Auto learning did not work for Samsung TV or Sony DVD Surround. Code "best programmed" for connection to my Samsung TV not properly mapped. Cannot connect to Sony DVD Surround System other than power On/Off. Only 4 IR learning buttons.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough.
customer_reviews.text: It has some caveats such as having to hold the PS button after not using it for a while, etc. However it works just fine for me. Not sure what all the complaints are about. I am fairly picky. It's certainly better than using a game controller and it gets me around Plex, Netflix, Amazon video, etc. I am not complaining. Been using it for at least a month now.
customer_reviews.author: Prime_Addict77

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Idk if I have a faulty remote or what. But in order to get the PS4 to even recognize the remote you have to remove the batteries and replace them in the remote. This is a huge pain, when it does work, which is rare, it works very well. Overall greatly disappointed in the poor quality of this remote.
customer_reviews.author: T 2 the J

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this
customer_reviews.text: As heart breaking as it is to say...this is a remote you can pass on. Had this remote for a few months now... Pros: It looks nicer than the similar PS3 remote Cons: It is VERY slow to respond. Various buttons that you think you don't need, but do, aren't there. Save yourself the $$ and pass on this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Big disappointment. I was really looking forward to this but unfortunately I'll be returning it. The buttons are made for the fingers of a 3 year old. I honestly had trouble pressing only 1 button when I was putting in device codes because the auto programming didn't work. The volume punch through doesn't work for amplifiers which is a basic feature on just about every universal remote.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T

customer_reviews.title: So so Sony
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote to use with PS4 VUE. It 's a basic remote that takes a bit of time to get to know how its features work. It beats using the PS4 controller when in VUE mode. Only downfall is that you can't just push the power off button to turn off the PS4, at least that has been my experience. You have to go thru a series of steps with this remote to power off your unit or put it in sleep mode. A little less button pushing would be nice when I'm ready to turn the unit off.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: One serious issue!
customer_reviews.text: Very slow to connect! I have to give it a harsh rating because Sony should have fixed that before bringing it to market. It takes over 10 seconds to power up, connect, and become active. That might mean that the Bluetooth in this controller is far out of date. There is no excuse for this, as my game controllers are older (they came with the console), and this item is still new (it came, like, 2 years later).
customer_reviews.author: James Marshall

customer_reviews.title: A good, but not perfect, remote...
customer_reviews.text: It is great so far. Flawlessly synced to my TV, which was nice. I would definitely be more willing to give it 5 stars if it weren't for the fact that the controller pairs to the PS4 via Bluetooth, which takes about 20 to 30 seconds everytime I click the "PS4" button on the remote. If you're a regular Netflix/Amazon Prime viewer, this is a great idea and worth the money. However, it's not exactly necessary, just nice to have ready when all you want to do is sit down and watch a movie or TV show.
customer_reviews.author: WoolyReviews

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Its about half as functional as just using the PS4 controller. There is no "back" function when using apps like Hulu. Very disappointed in this official product. Sony made a big mistake entrusting PDP to develop the official PS4 media remote. Sorry Sony but this was a big swing and a miss.
customer_reviews.author: NateDiz

customer_reviews.title: Can't begin to compare to the PS3 remote that should have served as the design goal.
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. I can not stress how disappointing this train wreck of a remote is... if you enjoyed the quality and functionality of the official PS3 remote and thought that this was going to accomplish the same results on the PS4 you are majorly mistaken. This remote eats the AAA batteries is uses and does not even do the basics well It fails to even implement all the buttons on the PS4 controller and they failed in basic ergonomics as well One example is the tiny mute button on the remote. Makes the mute function almost unusable. Skip this product and save up for a Logitech remote that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Functional but that's about it
customer_reviews.text: While this remote works, it is not anywhere near as good as the Sony remote for the PS3. The main problem I have with it, is it appears to go into standy-by mode causing you to have to press buttons several times to access the PS4. Battery usage is not great either. You can expect to change batteries every 2-3 weeks with this remote. It gets the job done but I wish there was a better alternative.
customer_reviews.author: chetholt

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a let down from the PS3 remote. This remote is junk do not waist your money!!! We have had this remote for about 3 months and have replaced the batteries 4 times already (all new fresh batteries). It is a battery eater, I have never seen a remote draw so much power. The other huge negative is the lack of function, the remote only works with some apps but not all. It has limited function with the HULU app and needs to be shut down and reset each time you want to go back up. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Piston85

customer_reviews.title: Pre-ordered this device as it was advertised to be a ...
customer_reviews.text: Pre-ordered this device as it was advertised to be a universal learning remote. Let down by the fact there is only 4 programable learning buttons. Secondly the volume punch through only works for the TV device and not the AMP which is insane. This however can be worked around by simply programming the TV button with your AMP codes and just living with the buttons being labeled wrong as any device key can be programmed with any type of device. Couldn't get it to work with my Channel Master CM7500 DVR+ at all to spite it having a few CM and Echostar codes, so the cbl device is dead to me.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote the end of November and it worked fine!!! Today is Feb 1st and the remote does not control my playstation unit anymore at all and I’m extremely disappointed because i watch a lot of Netflix and Hulu and bought this remote because It could control both my tv and PlayStation. I have tried using new batteries and disconnected the remote thinking reconnecting would work and it did not. I loved it while it worked which was a short month. Do not buy this product find another one.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: This thing eats batteries like candy..
customer_reviews.text: I don't have some of the issue others have had. It works ok for what I want it for. I watch netflix and this remote is way better than using a controller. But I have to change the batteries like once every couple of weeks. Why does it need so much juice? Why didn't they just give it four batteries? Did they even test this thing?
customer_reviews.author: c0rwyn

customer_reviews.title: It's a good remote. A bit slimmer than the PS3 remote ...
customer_reviews.text: Now that I've had the remote for a while I'm changing my rating. I do not like that it goes into sleep mode and I also do not like that it burns thru batteries really fast! I've even tried lithium batteries and it still dies really quick. I've discovered just using the gaming controller is almost as easy and at least it's rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: jujoak

customer_reviews.title: OK, not great but usable.
customer_reviews.text: Does basically what it should. Major faults are 1) back button doesn't work with Hulu, 2) powers down after 30 min (have to hit PS button to wake up again, which is majorly inconvenient if trying to pause or stop video) 3) eats batteries like a fiend (needs replacement batteries once a month or so). No comparison to Sony ps3 bt remote, once again Sony puts customers 2nd.
customer_reviews.author: Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Complete Junk
customer_reviews.text: This remote is absolutely worthless. It not only only partially worked when it worked at all, but it has now stopped working altogether. For a product to completely fail in such a short time (2 weeks after I got it) is preposterous. Don't waste your money, and shame on Sony for not coming out with a remote at launch. Lazy and stupid.
customer_reviews.author: DarthViper

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I grew toed and annoyed of having to use my controller - which is sensitive - to operate while watching program content. It paired pretty easy to my PS4 and now I don't have to use a controller when watching Blu-ray movies or Netflix, making things very convenient for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kon-el

customer_reviews.title: A far cry from the PS3 remote
customer_reviews.text: Non-standard button layout. When you're watching a movie you can't tell which button you're pushing so you end up hitting the PlayStation button. Pretty much you're better off holding onto your game controller and throwing this in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Should have been better
customer_reviews.text: Does not seem programmable as it states to learn functions from other remotes. Works beautifully on Netflix but that's it. Actually have not used it with Amazon prime videos. Hulu however you get stuck in the show you select. Works with Dish receiver but not RCA sound bar that I have. Not as good as the ps3 remote.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: The second gen PS3 controller was perfect and this one looked really close to it
customer_reviews.text: Really wish Sony had released their own controller for this system. The second gen PS3 controller was perfect and this one looked really close to it. But close only counts in horseshoes. The rubbery buttons are awkward, but worse is that the remote will disconnect after some inactivity and won't send signals till it takes the time to reconnect, unlike the PS3 BT controllers.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sizemore

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: The playstation 3 media remote, which I have had for years, works significantly better. This thing eats batteries like no other device I've ever seen in my life. I've changed the batteries 4 times since purchase, and haven't had to change the ps3 remote batteries once in that time. The remote turns off on it's own after a few minutes, so you have to hit the PS button to turn it back on. Then you have to switch between PS and TV inputs to change volume. I was excited for this because of how well the PS3 media remote has worked for years, but this product took several steps back.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Hollingshead

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase price!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly fine. My only gripe about it is that the remote seems to go into a power saving mode... So if you want to pause your movie halfway through you might have to hit the PS button in order to reestablish the connection. For disc and steaming video viewing, and working the PS operating system, this remote is a definite improvement over using the game controller.
customer_reviews.author: WufPup

customer_reviews.title: Only for heavy Netflix, hulu, etc users, otherwise controllers are way better
customer_reviews.text: It isn't really great, it is useful as in it works well on the ps4(netflix machine). it is odd how the volume and all televison keys do not work unless you hit the button for it(the grey tv button i mean, duh...). I really wish it would at least work like any other universal remote or at least like the ps3(gaming beast) universal remote. Hopefully the future version will be seamless like all other ps remote combos
customer_reviews.author: family

customer_reviews.title: Overall I am happy with the Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth about purchasing the Universal Media Remote knowing that it produced not by Sony but PDP. Overall I am happy with the Purchase. Syncing it with the PS4 was very quick and I haven't experienced some of the other issues reviewers have discussed i.e. poor battery life etc. If you are looking for a great way to control your PS4 and specifically if you use Sony's Vue digital TV service I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mason Cook

customer_reviews.title: I thought I would give it a try but it was money wasted really. Do not recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Cheap quality, some of the functions do not work as they do if using the dualshock remote. Favorites channels don't sync, when you want to control the volume, you have to press TV, then press PS to change channels. It's not even made by SONY, which should be a red flag right away. I thought I would give it a try but it was money wasted really. Do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Valenzuela

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the PS3 media remote
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the PS3 media remote. I'm not sure why Sony decided to nerf the media remote, but they did. It's just not as good. Use the normal controller, you'll have better control than with the media remote
customer_reviews.author: Yancy Hoyle

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst remote control for ANY device I've EVER had! It works occasionally, but not effectively. I can not say enough bad things about how ineffective and horrible this item is, so I'll just give it one star (because zero stars is not an option) and I'll close by saying DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PIECE OF JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Nightwing

customer_reviews.title: It does look pretty nice and has a nice feel
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, wish Sony had spent more time with this and made it more Vue friendly. Also really needs a backlight, and the punch through does NOT work on my amp, which I was looking forward to. Also having to wait for it to synch via bluetooth after it disconnects is insane. It does look pretty nice and has a nice feel. Dang you Sony, I wish you had really tried harder with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B. Gleaves

customer_reviews.title: If this missing feature doesn't bother you then this remote works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems to work as advertised except you are supposed to be able to lock the volume to a certain device. This way when you are operating the PS4, TV, etc. the volume will be locked to the volume source so you don't have to switch to that source. The manual says you can do this, but you cannot with this remote. The makers of this remote (PDP) said they have an updated remote so I'll probably be returning this one and buying directly from their site. If this missing feature doesn't bother you then this remote works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: Needs a nuclear reactor.
customer_reviews.text: You will need to invest in rechargeable batteries. This this EATS thorough batteries like a sumo wrestler at lunch time. Also you cannot use the volume for tv while using the ps4 function on some tvs(mine unfortunately, insignia tv).
customer_reviews.author: David A. Stokan

customer_reviews.title: I'd wait until they do it better.
customer_reviews.text: The remote is solid for a remote. The circle button doesn't work on Hulu so you have get out of Hulu then go back in to get to the Hulu home screen. It eats batteries for breakfast, lunch and dinner seriously I didn't get a month out of new batteries. Volume for the tv only works in tv mode, so you have to switch from ps4 back to tv to change volume then back to ps4. I wouldn't buy it again, I'd wait until they do it better.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph St Louis

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed with this remote
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this remote. It's too late to return it so I guess I'm stuck. Every pair of batteries I put in this thing die in 30 minutes. I have tried brand new energizer and rechargeable batteries. Same thing....all die. Anyone else have this problem?
customer_reviews.author: Raymond C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: This remote works but with issues. The PS3 remote was a lot more responsive than this PS4 remote. It connects to the system very slowly. Sometimes it registers multiple rapid-fire keystrokes when I'm not actually pressing keys anymore. The battery life is terrible. I think the Bluetooth component of this is the main issue as it should have been standard IR which works without having to connect every single time I want to use it. I will keep it but I don't plan to get another version from this company if they release an update as this remote is nowhere near worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: A.P.

customer_reviews.title: OK when it works...
customer_reviews.text: Had control since it was released. I don't think I have ever gone through so many batteries before. I can not even go a month without having to change out the batteries. Now I'm having issues with the control not functioning properly. It is acting like it can't connect but it is connected. Keeps turning the ps4 on at random times. Not sure what Sony was thinking hear.
customer_reviews.author: Gordo1603

customer_reviews.title: Terrible remote!
customer_reviews.text: An awful product. I've had this remote for about a month and, I suppose, makes browsing Netflix and Amazon somewhat easier. But the remote feels lightweight and cheap. And, even worse, batteries last about a week. That's new batteries, name brand batteries, generic batteries, whatever. This remote eats up batteries like nothing. Just buy a generic remote, don't waste your time or money with this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Pappas

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! Remote stopped working after a month.
customer_reviews.text: My remote stopped responding via Bluetooth after about a month of usage. It will connect to my PS4 using Bluetooth but after about 10 seconds it stops responding even though it's technically still connected. I've tried everything to reset it or the device connection but nothing is working. Unfortunately I'm past the return point and cannot get in touch with the seller to see if they'll replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: A terrible product. I loved the official multimedia remote for ...
customer_reviews.text: A terrible product. I loved the official multimedia remote for the PS3 but this PS4 version is nothing like it. As others have mentioned, it is smaller, lighter, and less comfortable. It has to be "woken up" before it works. It lacks some of the useful buttons (L1/L2) etc. I simply wanted a remote that allowed easy control of Netflix/Hulu and Blu-Ray movies and sadly this remote is not very good for that either. It will continue to sit unused and gather dust in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Rogers

customer_reviews.title: This product was terrible. I thought I was doing something wrong and ...
customer_reviews.text: This product was terrible. I thought I was doing something wrong and reprogrammed the thing about 5 times. It seems to work with my TV all the time but the PS4 is another story. On rare occasion it will operate without hitch and the rest of the time it won't do anything. I am surprised Sony would support such a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney W

customer_reviews.title: Best remote on the market but you better have recharagable AAA batteries.
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be the best remote on the market for PlayStation 4 and works well enough with most apps (Netflix works great but not so much with VUDU). However, I have had it since it was released in October 2015 and as of December 2015 have already needed to change out the batteries three times in two months with limited use. I probably would have been better off shelling out the extra cash and purchasing a Logitech Harmony Home universal remote which apparently has fixed prior compatibility issues with the PlayStation 4.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Martinez

customer_reviews.title: It won't control apps like hulu.
customer_reviews.text: it doesn't interface as well as the ps3 version did with its counter part. It won't control apps like hulu...will get into it but wont allow for back out so you have to shut the app down to get back. But for the apps it will work on it works just fine
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S. Boutz

customer_reviews.title: Huge Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: It only works with some apps and is completely useless for others. Since it's a licensed product I expected it to be compatible with apps besides Netflix. It doesn't work with Hulu or Amazon. The build quality is mediocre. Overall, do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Josh K.

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for about a month or two
customer_reviews.text: I got one. It worked great for about a month or two. Then it just stopped working. So I figured I'd order another. This one didn't even work. No lights would appear, and when trying to pair it with the PS4 it would appear as a blank line. I am not convinced that these are designed to work.
customer_reviews.author: Skribs

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY...seriously (unless you enjoy being annoyed).
customer_reviews.text: Like many, I was eagerly awaiting this remote's release. EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED. I'm not going to list its many flaws; I'll just say it doesn't work properly, is designed poorly (size/location of buttons, etc), and will definitely end up frustrating you w/ each use.
customer_reviews.author: S. GIBSON

customer_reviews.title: WORSE REMOTE EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks! It works when it wants to. Unlike the Universal Remote for PS3, this doesn't work for all your multimedia. It works for some Netflix shows and it not at all for HULU. It freezes up when watching a DVD or Blu Ray. I feel like throwing it away but I spent $25 and it serves as a paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: William S. Montalvo

customer_reviews.title: thinking of returning
customer_reviews.text: i won't work with VUDU and other apps on the playstation which was a why i bought it thinking of returning
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: PlayStation 4 Universal Media Remote [Old Model]
product_meta.description: Enjoy a convenient and intuitive way to navigate and control your favorite PS4 entertainment Apps and Blu-Ray Disc player right from your couch. The remote uses Bluetooth to control your PS4 system and can also be setup to control up to three additional devices, including a TV, cable box and audio receiver.
feature_bullets: Intuitive Control: Enjoy a convenient way to navigate and control your PlayStation 4 system with ease.
Command up to Four Devices: Control your PS4 system and up to three additional devices, including a TV, cable box and audio receiver.
Connects via Bluetooth: Uses Bluetooth to control your PS4 system.
Dedicated PS4 Buttons: Includes the most important buttons for navigating system menus and apps including the Action buttons (triangle, circle, cross, and square), Share, Options, and PS buttons.
NOTE: May not be compatible with certain receivers and support for some PS4 apps are in the process of being implemented. For more on compatibility and future updates, please visit the PDP website.
